# List of wars involving Saudi Arabia

This is a list of wars involving the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and its predecessor states.
First Saudi state (1744–1818)

Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (1932–present)
{|class="wikitable"
! style="background:#007733" width="190"|
! style="background:#007733" width="160"|
! style="background:#007733" width="160"|
! style="background:#007733" width="290"|
! style="background:#007733" width="120"|
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Saudi–Yemeni War(1934)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Saudi Arabia
| style="background:#efefef" |  Yemen
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
* Treaty of Taif signed on 14 June 1934, guaranteeing 20 years of peace between Saudi Arabia and Yemen
* Saudi Arabia leaves and Yemen gains control of Al-Hudaydah
* Jizan, Asir, and Najran became the provinces of Saudi Arabia
| rowspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| First Arab–Israeli War(1948–1949)
|style="background:#efefef"|
* :
**
***  All-Palestine Protectorate
****  Holy War Army
**
**
**  Syria
**
**
** Irregulars:
*  Arab Liberation Army
**  Al-Najjada
*  Holy War Army
|style="background:#efefef"|
* Before 26 May 1948:
*  Yishuv
* Paramilitary groups:
**  Haganah
**  Palmach
**  Hish
**  Him
**  Irgun
**  Lehi
** Allied Bedouin tribesAfter 26 May 1948:
*   Israel Defense Forces
**  Minorities Unit
* Foreign volunteers:
* Mahal
|style="background:#FFD0D0"|Defeat
* Arab League invasion of former Mandatory Palestine repelled
* 1949 Armistice Agreements
* Establishment of the State of Israel, Jordanian annexation of the West Bank, Egyptian occupation of the Gaza Strip
* 1948 Palestinian expulsion and flight
* Beginning of the Palestinian Fedayeen insurgency
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| North Yemen Civil War(1962–1965)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Kingdom of Yemen
|style="background:#efefef"|  Yemen Arab Republic
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
* Saudi Arabia stopped supplying the Royalists
|style="background:#efefef" rowspan=1|
|-

|style="background:#efefef"|

|style="background:#efefef"|

* At the final ceasefire:
** Egyptian forces held  on the eastern bank of the canal.
** Israeli forces held  on the western bank of the canal.
** Israeli forces held  of the Syrian Bashan region of the Golan Heights.
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Lebanese Civil War(1976–1979)
|style="background:#efefef"|  ADF
*
*
*
*
*
*
|style="background:#efefef"|  LF FLA
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
* ADF mission goals achieved
* ADF becomes an all-Syrian force in 1979
| style="background:#efefef" rowspan=2 |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" |Grand Mosque seizure(1979)
| style="background:#efefef" |
| style="background:#efefef" |  Ikhwan
| style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*Saudi troops suppress uprising
* Execution of  Juhayman and his followers publicly by decapitation
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Gulf War(1990–1991)
| style="background:#efefef" |  United States
| style="background:#efefef" |  Iraq
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
* Iraqi withdrawal from Kuwait; Emir Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah restored
* Heavy casualties and destruction of Iraqi and Kuwaiti Infrastructure
| style="background:#efefef" rowspan="3" |
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Iraqi No-Fly Zone Enforcement Operations(1991–2003)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|  Iraq
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
* Various bombings of Iraqi forces both aerial and naval
* Mass numbers of Iraqi targets killed or destroyed
* Reduction in Iraqi air defense
* Beginning of the Iraq War
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| First Intervention in the Somali Civil War(1992–1995)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|  Somali National Alliance
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
* Failure to capture SNA leader Mohamed Farrah Aidid; specific Aidid lieutenants captured
* Civil war is ongoing
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Operation Ocean Shield(2009–2016)
| style="background:#efefef" |
| style="background:#efefef" |  Somali pirates
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
* Number of pirate attacks have decreased dramatically since the start of such operations, however attacks still occur near the coast waters of Oman, Yemen, Kenya, and Somalia
* Piracy drops 90%
| rowspan="4" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Sixth Sa'dah War(2009–2010)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|  Houthis
|style="background:#E0D0FF"| Stalemate
* Houthis consolidate control over Sa'dah
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| American-led intervention in the Syrian civil war
(2014–2018)
|style="background:#efefef"| CJTF-OIR

* United Kingdom
* France
* Saudi Arabia
* United Arab Emirates

* Denmark
* Jordan
|style="background:#efefef"|

|-
|War on ISIS(2014–)
| Free Syrian Army Rojava United States
| Islamic State al-Nusra Front Khorasan
|Ongoing
* Multinational intervention against Syrian Islamists
|-
|Saudi Arabian–led intervention in Yemen(2015–)
| Hadi government
| Houthi government
*  Houthis
*  Saleh loyalists
---- Ansar al-Sharia
---- Islamic State
|Ongoing
* Houthis dissolve Yemeni government
* Houthis take control of northern Yemen
* Conflict in Najran, Jizan and Asir
